answers.answer: Thanks for using the forum.If your mother has been sick for 2-3 weeks, she is at risk of dehydration, electrolyte imbalances, not to mention that her blood sugar has probably not been well controlled. I recommend that you bring her to see a doctor as soon as possible. Please take her to the doctor, an ER, or an urgent care right away.Jaundice is a sign of damage to the liver. This is a serious medical concern and should be checked right away.Cathy
2 to 3 weeks of vomiting is life threatening she can die of dehydration she need to see an MD or the ER (emergency room).  Please seek medical help

question: My mom is having diabetes since past 14 years. From last 2-3 weeks she is having nausea and vomitting and is not able to eat anything. She has taken medicines- domistal, vomistop but there is no relief. Are these things related to jaundice.?
title: diabetic patient with nausea and vomitting
